about.summary: Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection. Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.

name: r-mlr
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.17.1" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-mlr
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/mlr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/mlr/mlr_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 0b71b9d00c627647cf5fc1f456d4445f025c90be2f974e05ccdb84e25ba1923b

build:
  merge_build_host: true  # [win]
  number: 1
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ compiler('c') }}              # [not win]
    - {{ compiler('m2w64_c') }}        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}filesystem        # [win]
    - {{ posix }}make
    - {{ posix }}sed               # [win]
    - {{ posix }}coreutils         # [win]
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-bbmisc >=1.11
    - r-paramhelpers >=1.10
    - r-xml
    - r-backports >=1.1.0
    - r-checkmate >=1.8.2
    - r-data.table
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-parallelmap >=1.3
    - r-stringi
    - r-survival
  run:
    - r-base
    - {{ native }}gcc-libs         # [win]
    - r-bbmisc >=1.11
    - r-paramhelpers >=1.10
    - r-xml
    - r-backports >=1.1.0
    - r-checkmate >=1.8.2
    - r-data.table
    - r-ggplot2
    - r-parallelmap >=1.3
    - r-stringi
    - r-survival

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('mlr')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('mlr')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/mlr-org/mlr
  license: BSD_2_clause
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental
    extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping
    and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection.
    Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.
  license_family: BSD

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Description: Interface to a large number of classification and regression techniques, including machine-readable parameter descriptions. There is also an experimental extension for survival analysis, clustering and general, example-specific cost-sensitive learning. Generic resampling, including cross-validation, bootstrapping and subsampling. Hyperparameter tuning with modern optimization techniques, for single- and multi-objective problems. Filter and wrapper methods for feature selection. Extension of basic learners with additional operations common in machine learning, also allowing for easy nested resampling. Most operations can be parallelized.
